document_data.mainbody: The '''Ilitul''' ({{Pronounce|ILL|ih|tul|refs={{Cite dungeon/190/Eye on the Realms: The Wild Lords|3}} centuries, [[Dalereckoning]].
document_data.Organization: In the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, the Ilitul family was headed by Murgos Ilitul and his consort [[Zorene Ilitul|Zorene]]. Their eldest son was [[Zak Ilitul]].
document_data.Activities: The Ilituls made their fortune as [[goat]] herders and broadened their interests to include [[mercenary]] [[fighter]]s.
document_data.Base of Operations: [[File:IlitulVilla-1372.png|thumb|right|270px|''The Ilitul Villa is labeled as $17.'']] The Ilitul villa was located in the [[Waterdeep/Sea Ward|Sea Ward]] on the south side of [[Ivory Street]] in the point it made between the [[Street of Whispers]] and the [[Street of the Singing Dolphin]]. Directly across Ivory Street was the villa belonging to the [[Emveolstone]] family. On the opposite corner were the [[Shrines of Nature]]. Across the Street of Whispers was the [[Melshimber]] family villa. [[File:IlitulVilla.png|thumb|right|270px|''The Ilitul Villa outlined in red, ''circa'' 1492 DR.'']]
document_data.Possessions: The family owned herds of goats, presumably kept outside the city.
document_data.Relationships: At some point in the early 1370s DR there was bad blood between the Ilituls and the [[Thorp (family)|Thorp family]] because [[Guster Ilitul]] was observed strangling [[Delbert Thorp]] during the second annual [[Black Bucket Hunt]] while they were exploring [[Undermountain]]. The viewing was accomplished by a modified ''[[arcane eye]]'' spell that projected the ''eye's'' view as an image that others could see.
document_data.History: The family was ennobled in the {{YearlinkName|1248}}. They were of [[Chondathan]] descent and held [[Tempus]] in high regard. As of 1372 DR there were 34 members that could claim nobility.
